comment: Summer online. His class was really unorganized but he sorted it out. We had a project (can be done in groups) and discussions. He makes you work for it and he doesnt grade easy especially on the project. Keep track of due dates because this semester alot of people did their discussions late and stated he wouldnt grade them. I was stuck on 89! ��
rating_tags: Participation matters--Graded by few things--Group projects

comment: I had Fowler for CGDD 2002 and am currently in his CGDD 3103 class, and I'm going to take him for every class I possibly can. He is a wonderful professor who really cares about his students. If you need more time on an assignment, he usually won't hesitate to help you out. You are graded on very few things, but he's a pretty easy grader.

Dr. Fowler (or Allan as he prefers us to use) is the best games prof at KSU. He know's his stuff. He cares about helping us learn. He uses real world experience and knowledge to help explain stuff that is difficult to understand. He sometimes is a bit late at grading assignments, but I am sure he tries his best.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Fowler is a wonderful professor and one of the best at KSU. Seriously, take his class if you get the chance. He doesn't just gives away grades and you will have to work for a grade but that should be the case in any major level course. He's funny, helpful and an all around great guy.

This guy was a brilliant professor. He was professional, incredibly helpful, and hilarious pretty much every day. He made class exciting and we learned a lot. We only had one project the entire semester, but we used everything we learned into it. Definitely recommend taking.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: He's a fairly new professor, but he made his class as much fun as possible. Just do well on the assignments and make sure you get into a good group for your final game.  You learn a lot :)

A new professor to KSU, but he is one of the best I have had ever. His lectures are great and he is hilarious. Is clear about the assignments he gives you and always provides good feedback in D2L. No textbook required for this class, and he made us buy some games on steam to play and review them! Definitely a solid professor and would take again.

Fowler was a great teacher. We only had him for the latter half of the semester, but it was a great experience. He really knows what he's talking about, unlike a lot of other game design teachers here. He did often forget to give feedback on our projects but he was always more than happy to talk about them if we asked. Do your work every week!
